content: february socks allison rose sizes one size women s medium measurements 3 5 8 9cm foot width 7 17 8cm total circumference length is adjustable yarn mc 50g of fingering weight yarn cc 5g of fingering weight yarn sample is knit in mc cascade heritage in the color strawberry cream 5648 75% superwash merino wool 25% nylon 3 5oz 100g = 437yds 400m cc bumblebee acres farms coquette sock in the color jolly red 75% superwash corriedale wool 25% nylon 4oz 113g = 434yds 396m needles 2 5mm us 1 5 circular needles with a cable long enough for magic loop knitting or small enough for small circumference knitting or 2 5mm dpns gauge 33 stitches x 49 row = 4 x 4 10cm x 10 cm in stockinette in the round on 2 5mm needles additional materials 2 stitch markers optional tapestry needle techniques used german twisted cast-on increasing decreasing stranded colorwork german short row picking up stitches kitchener bind-off if you have any questions about this pattern please feel free to contact @allisonroseshaw on instagram or email allisonrosecreates@gmail com if you share any pictures of work you make with this pattern on social media please tag me @ allisonroseshaw and use the hashtag #februarysocks - i d love to see what you make thank you 2 january socks by allison rose pattern the february socks are knit from the cuff down starting with a stretchy german twisted cast- on and a 1x1 rib cuff a stranded colorwork pattern is worked on the top edge of the sock with increases before and decreases after to adjust the stitch count followed by short row shaping to raise the back of the sock the heel is shaped using a heel flap and gusset with a french heel turn the remainder of the foot is knit in stockinette with a wedge toe and a kitchener bind off instructions are written for circular needles using the magic loop method abbreviations used throughout the pattern are explained on page 7 casting on & rib cuff cast-on 60 sts in the mc using the german twisted cast-on or your preferred stretchy cast-on of choice join to work in the round and divide so that you have 30sts on each needle video tutorial for the german twisted cast-on rounds 1-5 knit 5 rounds of 1x1 rib for the cuff *k1 p1* repeat * to * until end of round colorwork design the colorwork design is now worked on the cuff the colorwork chart is read bottom to top right to left make sure that you are knitting your colorwork loosely enough so that the sock can be put on comfortably round 1 knit one round round 2 *k15 m1* repeat * to * four times there are now 64sts on your needles rounds 3-9 knit the colorwork chart using the mc and cc the chart is work six times total around the circumference of the sock at the end of round 10 cut the cc yarn
